ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Visual predictive checks are a commonly used diagnostic plot in pharmacometrics, showing how certain statistics (percentiles) for observed data compare to those same statistics for data simulated from a model. The package can generate VPCs for continuous, categorical, censored, and (repeated) time-to-event data.

Visual predictive checks are a commonly used diagnostic plot in pharmacometrics, showing how certain statistics (percentiles) for observed data compare to those same statistics for data simulated from a model. The package can generate VPCs for continuous, categorical, censored, and (repeated) time-to-event data.

name: r-vpc
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.2.2" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-vpc
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/vpc_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/vpc/vpc_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 33c2e034e9ac944a6682482a8caa0b958b872d4465e34e52119b2b5ca1714997

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-classint
    - r-dplyr
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-readr
    - r-stringr
    - r-survival
    - r-tidyr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-classint
    - r-dplyr
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-readr
    - r-stringr
    - r-survival
    - r-tidyr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('vpc')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('vpc')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ronkeizer/vpc
  license: MIT
  summary: Visual predictive checks are a commonly used diagnostic plot in pharmacometrics, showing how certain statistics (percentiles) for observed data compare to those same statistics for data simulated from a model. The package can generate VPCs for continuous, categorical, censored, and (repeated) time-to-event data.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: vpc
# Title: Create Visual Predictive Checks
# Version: 1.1.0
# Date: 2018-08-27
# Author: Ron Keizer <ronkeizer@gmail.com>
# Maintainer: Ron Keizer <ronkeizer@gmail.com>
# Description: Visual predictive checks are a commonly used diagnostic plot in pharmacometrics, showing how certain statistics (percentiles) for observed data compare to those same statistics for data simulated from a model. The package can generate VPCs for continuous, categorical, censored, and (repeated) time-to-event data.
# Depends: R (>= 3.1.0)
# Imports: classInt, dplyr, reshape2, MASS, survival, ggplot2, readr
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# LazyData: true
# URL: https://github.com/ronkeizer/vpc
# Suggests: knitr, testit
# RoxygenNote: 6.0.1
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2018-08-27 20:41:53 UTC; ronkeizer
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2018-08-27 21:00:03 UTC
